intro: Conostephiopsis, commonly known as the white-flowered stephania, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Conostephiopsis alata, which is native to the dry regions of southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnate, with several pairs of leaflets, and the plant produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. Conostephiopsis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
